alert.note: Alert for East Puget Sound Lowlands (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 22 at 4:24AM PST until December 23 at 7:00PM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PST THIS EVENING... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 5 below zero. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy mixed precipitation possible. Total snow accumulations of up to three inches and ice accumulations of up to two tenths of an inch possible. * WHERE...East Puget Sound Lowlands from Snohomish County to Pierce County, including Arlington, Gold Bar, Duvall, Snoqualmie, Buckley, and Eatonville. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Advisory, until 10 PM PST this evening. For the Winter Storm Watch, from 4 PM PST this afternoon through Friday evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Coldest areas will occur nearest the gaps in the Cascades, especially along the I-90 and US-2 corridors. This is will be a complex mix of winter precipitation with potentially significant impacts.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. For sheltering information and other human services in your area, dial 2 1 1 during business hours or visit wa211.org anytime. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
